snippet: The leaders, brought to power amid an American counterinsurgency strategy, continue to rule villages, where people say the militias have turned to kidnappings and extortion.
abstract: Afghan militias, scattered across country after being elevated to power during American counterinsurgency strategy, continue to hold onto territory and rule villages as they battle Taliban; some units are fighting with discipline, but other militias have reputation for abuse and banditry.
lead_paragraph: The leaders, brought to power amid an American counterinsurgency strategy, continue to rule villages, where people say the militias have turned to kidnappings and extortion.

headline.main: Afghan Militia Leaders, Empowered by U.S. to Fight Taliban, Inspire Fear in Villages
headline.print_headline: After U.S. Exit, Rough Justice of Afghan Militias
